Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Horseback \Horse"back`\, n. 1. The back of a horse. [1913 Webster]
2. An extended ridge of sand, gravel, and boulders, in a half-stratified condition. --Agassiz. [1913 Webster]
{On horseback}, on the back of a horse; mounted or riding on a horse or horses; in the saddle. [1913 Webster]
The long journey was to be performed on horseback. --Prescott. [1913 Webster]

horseback n 1: the back of a horse 2: a narrow ridge of hills [syn: {hogback}] adv : on the back of a horse; "he rode horseback to town"; "managed to escape ahorse"; "policeman patrolled the streets ahorseback" [syn: {ahorse}, {ahorseback}]
